observation: I'm on the 'Select your residence' page during the sign-up flow. I can see a country selection dropdown with 'Select' as placeholder text, and a red Next button at the bottom. There are many country options available in the dropdown list, starting with Afghanistan and going alphabetically. As a 70-year-old user, I notice the text is reasonably sized but I need to select a country before proceeding.
reasoning: I need to select a country from the dropdown to proceed with the sign-up. As an elderly user, I'll look for a common English-speaking country that would be easy to find. I can see the United States would be a good choice, but I need to scroll through the list to find it since the list is alphabetical and currently showing countries starting with A-Z.
ux_issues: The country list is very long and requires significant scrolling to find countries later in the alphabet
No search functionality is immediately visible for the country selection
The dropdown shows many countries but finding a specific one requires manual scrolling

outcome.visual_observation: The scroll action on the Country selection dropdown did not open the dropdown or show any country options. The dropdown remains in its closed state with 'Select' placeholder text still visible. A red circular highlight appeared around the dropdown area, but no functional change occurred.
outcome.diagnosis: The dropdown component is not responding to scroll events. The scroll action should have opened the dropdown menu to display available country options, but the dropdown remains non-interactive.

console_logs: [warning] The resource https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/inter/v19/UcCo3FwrK3iLTcviYwYZ8UA3.woff2 was preloaded using link preload but not used within a few seconds from the window's load event. Please make sure it has an appropriate `as` value and it is preloaded intentionally.
